item.title: Ubisoft Management To Blame For Prince of Persia: The Lost Crown Sales Issues, Baldur’s Gate 3 Exec Says
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/ubisoft-management-to-blame-for-prince-of-persia-the-lost-crown-sales-issues-baldurs-gate-3-exec-says/

Those looking to for a reason as to why Prince of Persia: The Lost Crown sold below expectations thus leading to a sequel being rejected need to look to the top of Ubisoft.

That’s what Michael Douse, the director of publishing at Baldur’s Gate 3 developer Larian Studios, had to say about the situation.

In a social media post (h/t 80 Level), Douse pointed the fingers at Ubisoft management, saying that the decision to not release the game on Steam day one hurt any chance of the game’s success.

“The last notable game on their platform was arguably Far Cry 6 in 2021,” Douse said. “The Crew, Mirage and Avatar came in 2023 and didn’t perform, so you can assume subscriptions were at a lull when PoP released by 2024. Which means people wouldn’t be launching their store all too much.

“If it had released on Steam not only would it have been a market success, but there would likely be a sequel because the team are so strong.”

He then went on to call out the game’s critical success across the board.

“It’s such a broken strategy,” he said. “The hardest thing is to make a 85+ game — it is much, much easier to release one. It just shouldn’t be done as it was.

Prince of Persia: The Lost Crown has sold around one million copies since its launch, far below what the internal expectations were for the game. Insider Gaming learned that Ubisoft was was expecting the game to sell on par, or better, than some of biggest Metroidvania’s in the market. When that didn’t happen right away, a decision was made to move on from the project.

Now, the team that developed Prince of Persia: The Lost Crown is no more after Ubisoft disbanded them to move on to different games.

What do you think of Douse’s comments on why Prince of Persia: The Lost Crown failed to sell better for Ubisoft? Let us know down below, or in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, check out what recently launched game has hit the 1 million copies sales mark. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Black Ops 6 Players Should Change this Setting for Better ADS
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/black-ops-6-players-should-change-this-setting-for-better-ads/

A Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 player has figured out that Tactical Sprint Assist can cause a significant delay while aiming, and changing this setting can make the gameplay much faster for players. 

Spotted by Lightsfire on X (via VG247), enabling Tactical Sprint Assist on Black Ops 6 increases the time it takes for players to pull up their ADS. His video includes gameplay comparisons of when Sprint Assist is toggled as ‘Tactical Sprint Assist’ or set as ‘On’. You can see a visible delay when using the former, while just setting Sprint Assist as ‘On’ makes players pull up their guns much faster.

To change this setting in Black Ops 6, players should open the ‘Settings’ menu and select the ‘Movement’ tab. Here, they will find a ‘Sprint Assist’ option under ‘Intelligent Movement’. They should open it and select ‘On’. 

If players still want to use Tactical Sprint while having faster ADS, there’s a way to do that, too. Players should head to ‘Movement Advanced Settings’, and under the ‘Movement Behaviours Tab’, they will find an option called ‘Tactical Sprint Activation’. The player should open it and select ‘Single Tap Run’. Now, players can have faster ADS while using Tactical Sprint. 

In other news, players will not have to wait long for Nuketown in Black Ops 6. Also, check out how to fix the Packet Burst issue of the game. What are your thoughts on this Black Ops 6 setting? Let us know in the comments or our new community forum!

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Microsoft’s ownership of 20 game franchises that have exceeded $1 billion in revenue. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Best LW3A1 loadout in Black Ops 6: Attachments, Perks & Equipment
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/best-lw3a1-loadout-in-black-ops-6-attachments-perks-equipment/

If you’re after a devastating one-hit Sniper Rifle that delivers a single crushing blow to almost anywhere on the body, the best LW3A1 Black Ops 6 Sniper Rifle class is what you’re after, and we have the best way to maximize its strengths.

The LW3A1 Frostline reminds me of many, classic one-hit Sniper Rifles from CoD games down the years: The M40A3 from Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare, the Intervention from 2009’s Modern Warfare 2, and the KATT-AMR is a recent favorite of mine. Now, it’s the turn of the LW3A1 in Black Ops 6—designed to honor the legacy of previous Sniper stalwarts.

When you start Black Ops 6, the LW3A1 is probably going to be your main multiplayer Sniper Rifle for a while, so let’s make the most of it, and turn it into your opponent’s living nightmare.

Best LW3A1 Attachments in Black Ops 6

  • Barrel: Long Barrel
  • Stock Pad: Lightweight Pad
  • Magazine: Extended Mag I
  • Comb: Quickdraw Riser
  • Stock: Heavy Stock

To start the best LW3A1 Sniper Rifle Class in Black Ops 6, I’ve gone for a tasty Long Barrel as it gives the LW3A1 a bit more range, allowing the gun a better chance to one-shot from miles away. The Lightweight Pad reduces sway, making our stability firmer and aiming tighter, whereas the Extended Mag I is a staple of a single-shot class in need of some extra shots in reserve.

The Quickdraw Riser Comb drastically decreases ADS speed, allowing us to zap an enemy quicker—which is extremely useful for a big brute such as the LW3A1. Finally, the Heavy Stock boosts our Flinch Resistance, meaning if we’re lining up a shot and our opponent lands a couple of lucky shots, our aim should be fairly steady, and make it easier to pop their head in the hunt for Camos.

Best Perks, Wildcard & Equipment for LW3A1 Frostline

  • Perk 1: Ghost
  • Perk 2: Forward Intel
  • Perk 3: Vigilance
  • Wildcard: Overkill
  • Lethal: Blast Trap
  • Tactical: Stim Shot
  • Field Upgrade: Spring Mine

Recon Perks are the direction we’ve gone for with the LW3A1 Sniper Rifle as you want to be covert and have all the intelligence. Ghost naturally keeps you obscured as much as possible—protecting your position—Forward Intel makes the minimap bigger and gives us a handy look at where our targets are, and Vigilance produces a warning indicator if you are spotted—allowing you a split-second to take action.

Overkill is the ideal Wildcard as we can pair our LW3A1 with something rapid for close quarters such as the Tanto .22. The Blast Trap is another piece of explosive insurance to fortify our position, the Stim Shot is a perfect pick-me-up to tank a few hits, and I’ve picked the Spring Mine to add another layer of defense.

Best Secondary for LW3A1 Frostline

If for some reason you disagree with our Overkill Wildcard pick, that’s fine, we still like you. But if you decide to do this, go for the Grekhova fully automatic Pistol because once you unlock it, you’ll never go back. It becomes available at Level 13 (unlucky for your enemies!) and should become a mainstay in your loadout.

How to unlock LW3A1 in Black Ops 6

Good news, the LW3A1 is unlocked from the beginning of Call of Duty: Black Ops 6. It’s the only one of the Sniper Rifles to be available from the get-go, so reach Level 4 to unlock Loadouts, add it to a class, and start accumulating all the attachments I’ve listed in our best setup.

Is the LW3A1 any good in Black Ops 6?

The LW3A1 is most certainly a very good gun as its one-hit-kill potential means it’s an extremely deadly weapon in even the most average of hands—and I mean this respectfully. If you can get to grips with the LW3A1, learn to keep your distance, and pick your shots, decent Killstreaks are mere fingertips away.

You have to be Level 25 to unlock the Dragunov as the next Sniper Rifle anyway, so you have plenty of time to become intimately acquainted with the LW3A1.

Best alternatives to the LW3A1 Frostline in Black Ops 6

Currently, Black Ops 6 only has three Sniper Rifles—with more likely to arrive as part of seasonal updates. That being said, once you unlock them, the SVD Dragunov and LR 7.62 need to be on your radar if you love engaging at long-range, or desire one-shot one-kill firepower.

Black Ops 6 has plenty to keep you busy: The Safehouse Puzzle Safe in need of cracking, and the Liberty Falls Vault are big standouts. For more general gaming news and guides, do subscribe to our free, weekly newsletter.

item.title: Best Tanto .22 Loadout in Black Ops 6: Attachments, Perks & Equipment
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/best-tanto-22-loadout-in-black-ops-6-attachments-perks-equipment/

Among all the other guns in the SMG category, the Tanto .22 stands out with a slow rate of fire but hard-hitting capabilities in Black Ops 6. To get the best out of the gun, you must use the ideal attachments, perks, and equipment to support your gameplay.

  • Best attachments
  • Best Perks, Wildcard & Equipment
  • Best Secondary for Tanto .22
  • How to unlock Tanto .22 in Black Ops 6
  • Is the Tanto .22 any good in Black Ops 6?
  • Best alternatives

Best Tanto .22 loadout attachments in Black Ops 6

  • Muzzle: Compensator
  • Barrel: Short Barrel
  • Under Barrel: Ranger Foregrip
  • Rear Grip: CQB Grip
  • Stock: Balanced Stock

The mentioned attachments will give you the best mobility while using the Tanto .22 in multiplayer lobbies. The Compensator will reduce the vertical recoil to improve accuracy while the Short Barrel will enhance in-air handling by improving Jumping Aim Down Sight and Jumping Sprint to Fire speeds.

Ranger Foregrip will greatly improve Horizontal Recoil Control and slightly improve Sprinting Movement Speed. Use the CQB Grip to dominate in close-range combat as it significantly boosts Dive To Fire, Slide to Fire, and Sprint to Fire Speeds, making it a perfect attachment to use Omnimovement in the best way possible.

Lastly, use the Balanced Stock for maximum mobility as it will improve Aim Walking, Hipfire, and Strafing Movement speeds.

Best Perks, Wildcard & Equipment for Tanto .22

  • Perk 1: Dexterity
  • Perk 2: Assassin
  • Perk 3: Double Time
  • Perk 4: Enforcer
  • Wildcard: Perk Greed
  • Lethal: Semtex
  • Tactical: Stim Shot
  • Field Upgrade: Spring Mine

Use Dexterity to reduce weapon motion while jumping, sliding, and diving while taking less fall damage. The Assassin perk will mark enemies with kill streaks on the minimap.

Double Time significantly increases the Tactical Sprint, which is essential when multiple enemies are nearby. These three perks will activate the Enforcer specialty which grants a temporary buff to your movement speed and health regeneration rate upon killing enemies.

Coming to the Wildcard, during the initial levels you can use Tactical Expert (it gives you two tactical equipment) but once you level up, get the Perk Greed to equip an extra Perk.

Semtex and Stim Shots are a must when you’re running the Tanto .22 for quick damage and heal-up. I’d say the Field Upgrade is a personal choice. For me, I find the Spring Mine useful as it grants me free kills from time to time.

Best Secondary for Tanto .22

The Stryder .22 is one of the best secondary weapons for the submachine gun. Want to finish off enemies when they are at one HP, use the Stryder to get the job done.

How to unlock Tanto .22 in Black Ops 6

Reach player level 16 to unlock the Tanto .22 SMG in Black Ops 6. This is easy to achieve – all you need to do is play the game. You can level up fast by playing some multiplayer matches and fulfilling all the objectives.

Is the Tanto .22 any good in Black Ops 6?

Yes, despite being an SMG with a slow rate of fire, it’s an excellent choice for close and medium-range combat. You don’t have empty half of its magazine on a single enemy and is easy to control as well.

With the attachments mentioned above, you can achieve great mobility with the Tanto .22, making it hard for the enemies to knock you down.

Best alternatives to the Tanto .22 in Black Ops 6

If the slow fire rate bothers you, go with the Jackal PDW SMG. It dominated lobbies during the beta and is equally impressive after the full release of the game.

And if you want to ditch the SMG route and choose hard-hitting Assault Rifles instead, then the AK-74 and XMR are two of the best guns to use.

Stay up to date with all the latest news and guides on Black Ops 6 by signing up for Insider Gaming’s weekly newsletter.
